title: pigs in space
description: This course uses the muppet movie **Pigs in Space** to demonstrate cultural differences in the United States, exploring themes of identity, communication, and societal norms through the lens of the Swinetrek crew's intergalactic adventures.

modules.title: Introduction to Pigs in Space and Cultural Studies
modules.description: This module introduces the 'Pigs in Space' segment and its characters, setting the stage for analyzing cultural representations and misinterpretations. We will also define key terms in cultural studies.

topics.title: Overview
topics.description: Course introduction and objectives.

topics.title: Introducing Pigs in Space
topics.description: A brief history and overview of the 'Pigs in Space' segment within The Muppet Show.

topics.title: Key Concepts in Cultural Studies
topics.description: Defining culture, identity, stereotypes, and ethnocentrism.

topics.title: The Swinetrek Crew: An Introduction
topics.description: Getting to know Captain Link Hogthrob, Miss Piggy as First Mate Piggy, and Dr. Julius Strangepork.

topics.title: Space as a Metaphor
topics.description: Examining space travel as a metaphor for encountering the 'other' and exploring unknown cultures.

topics.title: Early Episodes: Setting the Stage
topics.description: Analyzing the first few 'Pigs in Space' episodes for initial cultural representations.

modules.title: Analyzing American Identity Through Piggy
modules.description: This module focuses on Miss Piggy and her representation of American ideals and stereotypes, particularly those related to fame, beauty, and ambition.

topics.title: Piggy as an American Icon
topics.description: Exploring Miss Piggy's popularity and her embodiment of certain American values.

topics.title: Fame and Celebrity Culture
topics.description: How Miss Piggy's pursuit of fame reflects American celebrity culture.

topics.title: Beauty Standards and Representation
topics.description: Analyzing Miss Piggy's appearance and how it challenges or reinforces traditional beauty standards.

topics.title: Ambition and Success
topics.description: Examining Miss Piggy's relentless ambition and what it says about the American Dream.

topics.title: Gender Roles and Expectations
topics.description: Analyzing Miss Piggy's character in relation to traditional gender roles and expectations.

topics.title: Power Dynamics in the Swinetrek
topics.description: The role of Piggy as second in command and how she uses her position.

topics.title: Piggy's Relationships
topics.description: Piggy's interactions with Link and Dr. Strangepork.

modules.title: Link Hogthrob and Masculinity
modules.description: This module explores the character of Link Hogthrob and how he embodies and subverts traditional notions of American masculinity.

topics.title: Link Hogthrob: The All-American Hero?
topics.description: Analyzing Link's portrayal as a heroic figure and its connection to American ideals.

topics.title: Stereotypes of Masculinity
topics.description: Examining how Link embodies and challenges stereotypes of American masculinity.

topics.title: Leadership and Responsibility
topics.description: Analyzing Link's leadership style and his sense of responsibility towards the Swinetrek crew.

topics.title: Vulnerability and Humor
topics.description: Exploring moments where Link displays vulnerability or is the subject of humor, and what this reveals about his character.

topics.title: Link's Relationship with Piggy
topics.description: Analyzing the complex dynamics of Link and Piggy's relationship.

topics.title: The Evolution of Link's Character
topics.description: How Link's character changed through the different episodes.

topics.title: Link as a foil
topics.description: Examining Link's role as a foil to Piggy's character.

topics.title: The role of ego
topics.description: Examining how ego drives Link's behavior.

modules.title: Dr. Julius Strangepork and Scientific Culture
modules.description: This module analyzes Dr. Julius Strangepork and explores how the character represents American attitudes towards science, technology, and expertise.

topics.title: Strangepork as a Scientist
topics.description: Analyzing Strangepork's portrayal as a scientist and its connection to American perceptions of science.

topics.title: Technological Advancement
topics.description: Examining how the 'Pigs in Space' segment portrays technological advancements and their impact on society.

topics.title: The Role of the Expert
topics.description: Analyzing Strangepork's role as an expert and how his expertise is valued (or not) by the other characters.

topics.title: Science and Ethics
topics.description: Exploring any ethical dilemmas presented by Strangepork's experiments or inventions.

topics.title: Strangepork's Inventions
topics.description: A catalog of Strangepork's notable inventions and their significance.

topics.title: Strangepork's Communication Style
topics.description: Analysing how Strangepork's communication style impacts his relationship with the other crew members.

topics.title: The humor of science
topics.description: Examining the humor behind the portrayal of science in Pigs in Space.

topics.title: Mad Science
topics.description: How does Strangepork embody the trope of the mad scientist?

topics.title: Science and Pseudoscience
topics.description: Examining the line between science and pseudoscience in Pigs in Space.

modules.title: Intergalactic Encounters and Cultural Exchange
modules.description: This module examines the different alien species and planets encountered by the Swinetrek crew, analyzing how these encounters reflect American attitudes towards cultural exchange and the 'other'.

topics.title: Representations of Alien Cultures
topics.description: Analyzing how different alien species are portrayed and what cultural stereotypes they might represent.

topics.title: First Contact Scenarios
topics.description: Examining how the Swinetrek crew handles first contact scenarios and what this reveals about American approaches to diplomacy and cultural understanding.

topics.title: Language and Communication Barriers
topics.description: Analyzing the challenges of intergalactic communication and how they are portrayed in the segment.

topics.title: Cultural Misunderstandings
topics.description: Exploring instances of cultural misunderstandings and their comedic (or serious) consequences.

topics.title: The Concept of the 'Other'
topics.description: Analyzing how the 'Pigs in Space' segment portrays the concept of the 'other' and its implications for understanding cultural differences.

topics.title: Parodies of Science Fiction
topics.description: Examining the science fiction parodies presented in Pigs in Space and what they reveal about American culture.

topics.title: Space as a Neutral Zone
topics.description: Examining space as a neutral zone for cultural interaction.

topics.title: Cultural Imperialism
topics.description: Is there evidence of cultural imperialism in Pigs in Space?

topics.title: Humor and Cultural Sensitivity
topics.description: Examining the humor and cultural sensitivity in Pigs in Space.

topics.title: Star Trek Parallels
topics.description: Comparing the cultural representations in Pigs in Space to the cultural representations in Star Trek.

modules.title: Satire and Social Commentary
modules.description: This module delves into the satirical elements of 'Pigs in Space,' analyzing how the segment uses humor to comment on American society, politics, and culture.

topics.title: The Use of Satire in Pigs in Space
topics.description: Identifying and analyzing examples of satire in the segment.

topics.title: Political Commentary
topics.description: Examining any political commentary embedded within the 'Pigs in Space' storylines.

topics.title: Social Issues Addressed
topics.description: Identifying and analyzing any social issues that are satirized or commented upon in the segment.

topics.title: Parody of Genre Conventions
topics.description: Analyzing how 'Pigs in Space' parodies science fiction and other genre conventions.

topics.title: The Role of Humor in Social Critique
topics.description: Exploring how humor is used to deliver social critique and make audiences think critically.

topics.title: Cultural Norms and Values
topics.description: Examining how Pigs in Space reflects and challenges cultural norms and values.

topics.title: Target Audiences
topics.description: Who was the target audience for Pigs in Space?

topics.title: The enduring legacy of satire
topics.description: Examining why satire is still effective in modern society.

topics.title: The Muppets as Social Commentators
topics.description: Examining the role of the Muppets in creating social commentary.

topics.title: Satire and the Status Quo
topics.description: How satire challenges the status quo.

topics.title: The limits of satire
topics.description: When is satire not appropriate?

modules.title: Pigs in Space and American Media
modules.description: This module explores the 'Pigs in Space' segment within the broader context of American media, analyzing its influence and its reflection of media trends and practices.

topics.title: Pigs in Space as a Product of Its Time
topics.description: Analyzing how the segment reflects the media landscape and cultural trends of the late 1970s and early 1980s.

topics.title: The Influence of Science Fiction on Television
topics.description: Examining the influence of science fiction shows like 'Star Trek' on 'Pigs in Space'.

topics.title: The Muppets' Impact on Television
topics.description: Analyzing the broader impact of 'The Muppet Show' on television and its influence on other shows.

topics.title: Media Representation and Stereotypes
topics.description: Analyzing how 'Pigs in Space' reinforces or challenges media stereotypes.

topics.title: The Role of Humor in Media Consumption
topics.description: Exploring how humor influences media consumption and audience engagement.

topics.title: Pigs in Space and Merchandising
topics.description: Examining the merchandising surrounding Pigs in Space and The Muppets.

topics.title: The evolution of media
topics.description: How has media changed since the debut of Pigs in Space?

topics.title: Nostalgia and media
topics.description: Why do we feel nostalgia for certain media?

topics.title: The role of media in cultural identity
topics.description: How does media contribute to cultural identity?

topics.title: The power of television
topics.description: Examining the power that television has to influence society.

topics.title: The future of media
topics.description: What is the future of media?

topics.title: Pigs in Space and digital media
topics.description: Examining how digital media has impacted Pigs in Space.

modules.title: Cultural Relativism and Ethical Considerations
modules.description: This module explores the concept of cultural relativism in the context of 'Pigs in Space,' examining the ethical considerations that arise when encountering different cultures and value systems.

topics.title: Defining Cultural Relativism
topics.description: Explaining the concept of cultural relativism and its implications for understanding different cultures.

topics.title: Ethnocentrism vs. Cultural Relativism
topics.description: Contrasting ethnocentrism with cultural relativism and the importance of avoiding ethnocentric biases.

topics.title: Ethical Dilemmas in Intercultural Encounters
topics.description: Analyzing ethical dilemmas that arise when encountering cultures with different values and norms.

topics.title: Universal Human Rights vs. Cultural Practices
topics.description: Exploring the tension between universal human rights and culturally specific practices.

topics.title: Applying Cultural Relativism to 'Pigs in Space'
topics.description: Analyzing specific episodes of 'Pigs in Space' through the lens of cultural relativism.

topics.title: Moral judgements
topics.description: Examining how moral judgements impact our perception of other cultures.

topics.title: Bias in cultural representation
topics.description: How does bias impact cultural representation?

topics.title: The dangers of generalization
topics.description: Examining the dangers of making generalizations about other cultures.

topics.title: Empathy and understanding
topics.description: How can empathy and understanding help us navigate cultural differences?

topics.title: The role of context
topics.description: How does context impact our understanding of other cultures?

topics.title: Cultural appropriation
topics.description: Examining the concept of cultural appropriation.

modules.title: Capstone Project: Pigs in Space and Contemporary Issues
modules.description: In this final module, students will apply the concepts learned throughout the course to analyze a contemporary cultural issue through the lens of 'Pigs in Space'.

topics.title: Project Overview and Guidelines
topics.description: Detailed explanation of the capstone project requirements and expectations.

topics.title: Choosing a Contemporary Issue
topics.description: Guidance on selecting a relevant and appropriate contemporary cultural issue.

topics.title: Connecting Pigs in Space to the Issue
topics.description: Strategies for drawing parallels between 'Pigs in Space' themes and the chosen contemporary issue.

topics.title: Research and Analysis
topics.description: Conducting research and analyzing the chosen issue from a cultural studies perspective.

topics.title: Developing a Thesis Statement
topics.description: Crafting a clear and concise thesis statement for the capstone project.

topics.title: Structuring the Project
topics.description: Guidance on structuring the capstone project effectively.

topics.title: Presentation Skills
topics.description: Tips and techniques for presenting the capstone project effectively.

topics.title: Peer Review and Feedback
topics.description: Providing and receiving constructive feedback on capstone projects.

topics.title: Final Project Submission
topics.description: Instructions for submitting the final capstone project.

topics.title: Examples of Past Projects
topics.description: Examining examples of successful capstone projects from previous courses.

topics.title: Q&A Session
topics.description: A question and answer session to address any remaining questions about the capstone project.
